mxCell.value: TRIZ Framework v5.0 - Comprehensive Innovation Management System with Expanded Building Blocks
Core Innovation Process Flow
P0: Strategic Alignment & Project Selection
P1: Problem Analysis & Formulation
P2: Contradiction Identification & Resolution
P3: Solution Generation & Conceptualisation
P4: Concept Evaluation & Refinement
P5: Implementation & Validation
P6: Knowledge Capture & Dissemination
P7: Continuous Improvement & Innovation Culture
TRIZ Building Blocks - Detailed View
🔍 BB1: Problem Definition & Analysis
S1.1: Define Specific Problem • 5 Whys • Ishikawa Diagram • Is-Is Not Analysis
S1.2: Ideal Final Result (IFR) • IFR Canvas • Ideality Equation • Zero cost, Zero harm
S1.3: Function Analysis • Useful functions • Harmful functions • Cause-Effect chains
S1.4: Resource Analysis • Substance resources • Field resources • Space/Time/Info resources
S1.5: System Boundaries • System level • Super-system • Sub-system
S1.6: Early Trimming • Low-value functions • Harmful functions • Cost reduction
Tools: T5 (9-Windows), T7 (Function Analysis)
Example: Jet engine blade failure analysis using function modeling
⚔️ BB2: Contradiction Matrix & 40 Inventive Principles
S2.1: Technical Contradictions • Improving parameter • Worsening parameter • 39 Engineering parameters
S2.2: Matrix Lookup • Classical Matrix • Matrix 2003 • Matrix 2010
S2.3: Physical Contradictions • Separation in Space • Separation in Time • Separation on Condition • Parts/Whole separation
S2.4: Interface Contradictions • System boundaries • Interface conflicts • Interface Analysis Matrix
40 Inventive Principles: 1. Segmentation 2. Taking out 3. Local quality 4. Asymmetry 5. Merging 6. Universality 7. Nesting 8. Anti-weight ... and 32 more principles
Tools: T1 (Contradiction Matrix Web App)
Example: Boeing wing - Stronger (↑) leads to More weight (↓) → Use principles 1, 8, 15, 35
🧬 BB3: Substance-Field (Su-Field) & 76 Standard Solutions
S3.1: Model Su-Field • S1 - First substance • S2 - Second substance • F - Field interaction
S3.2: Standard Solutions Class 1: Build/destroy Class 2: Develop Class 3: Transitions Class 4: Detection Class 5: Application
S3.3: Chain Su-Fields • Sequential processes • Parallel processes • Complex interactions
Model Types: • Incomplete Su-Field (missing element) • Harmful Su-Field (unwanted effect) • Insufficient Su-Field (weak interaction)
Common Fields: • Mechanical • Thermal • Chemical • Electric • Magnetic • Acoustic
Tools: T2 (Su-Field Modeller)
Example: Ultrasonic cleaning - S1(dirt) + S2(surface) + F(acoustic field) → Clean surface
🗂️ BB4: ARIZ (Algorithm for Inventive Problem Solving)
9 Parts of ARIZ:
Part 1: Problem Analysis • Mini-problem • Conflict analysis • IFR-1
Part 2: Problem Model • Operating zone • Operating time • Su-Field resources
Part 3: IFR & PC • IFR-2 formulation • Physical contradiction • Macro/Micro PC
Part 4: Resources • Substance • Field • Space/Time
Part 5: Information • Standards • Analogies • Effects DB
Part 6: Solution • Concept synthesis • Secondary problems • Evaluation
Parts 7-9: • Solution Analysis • Application Planning • Process Review
Tools: T8 (ARIZ Assistant)
Note: ARIZ is used for complex problems where other TRIZ tools haven't provided breakthrough solutions
📈 BB5: Trends of Engineering System Evolution
S5.1: S-Curve Position • Birth (emerging) • Growth (rapid improvement) • Maturity (optimization) • Decline (replacement)
8 Laws of System Evolution:
1. System Completeness 2. Energy Conductivity 3. Harmonization 4. Ideality
5. Uneven Development 6. Transition to Super-system 7. Transition to Micro-level 8. Increasing Use of Fields
S5.3: Forecast Next Stage • Evolution Potential Radar • Technology Roadmapping • Competitive analysis • Patent landscape
Evolution Patterns: • Mono → Bi → Poly systems • Rigid → Flexible → Fluid → Field • Manual → Semi-auto → Automatic • 2D → 3D → 4D (time)
Example: Smartphones at maturity → Next: AR glasses, brain interfaces (transition to super-system)
🔬 BB6: Scientific Effects & Knowledge-Base Search
Effect Categories:
• Mechanical Effects - Leverage - Resonance - Gyroscopic
• Thermal Effects - Phase change - Thermal expansion - Peltier effect
• Chemical Effects - Catalysis - Oxidation - Polymerization
• Electronic Effects - Piezoelectric - Photoelectric - Semiconductor
• Magnetic/Optical/Bio - Magnetostriction - Laser effects - Biomimetics
Search Process: 1. Define required function 2. Search effects database (7,000+ effects) 3. Evaluate: Efficiency, Control, Cost, Reliability 4. Patent/literature search for applications
Tools: T4 (Scientific Effects DB), T3 (PatentLens API)
Examples: Shape-memory alloy for valves, Piezoelectric for precision positioning
🪟 BB7: 9-Windows System Analysis
9-Windows Matrix:
Analysis Questions: • What resources exist in each window? • What constraints apply? • What opportunities emerge?
Tool: T5 (9-Windows Digital Canvas)
✂️ BB8: Function Trimming
S8.1: Function Ranking • Value contribution (High/Med/Low) • Cost (High/Med/Low) • Harm caused (High/Med/Low)
S8.2: Trimming Rules Rule A: Object self-performs Rule B: Another component performs Rule C: Function eliminated with object
S8.3: Apply Trimming • Remove low-value components • Redistribute useful functions • Eliminate harmful functions
S8.4: Verify System Integrity ✓ All useful functions preserved ✓ No new harmful functions ✓ Cost reduction achieved
Tool: T7 (Function Analysis & Trimming Tool)
Benefits: Reduced complexity, Lower cost, Higher reliability, Easier maintenance
🚀 BB9: Implementation Roadmap
S9.1: Prototype Development • Proof of concept • Alpha prototype • Beta prototype • Production prototype
S9.2: Testing & Validation • Functional tests • Performance tests • Reliability (MTBF) • Safety & User acceptance
S9.3: Iterative Refinement • PDCA cycle • Continuous improvement • Feedback integration
S9.4: Scale-up Planning • Manufacturing process design • Supply chain setup • Quality control systems • Cost optimization
S9.5: IP Protection • Patent filing • Trade secrets • Freedom-to-operate
Tools: Rapid Prototyping, 3D Printing, Simulation Software, Project Management Tools
Key Metrics: Cycle time, Defect rate, Cost vs. budget, Customer satisfaction
📚 BB10: Post-Project Review & Knowledge Capture

S10.1: Retrospective
• Start-Stop-Continue
• Team feedback
• Stakeholder input

S10.2: Document Lessons
• Technical insights
• Process improvements
• Tool effectiveness

S10.3: Update Knowledge Base
• Case studies
• Solution patterns
• Best practices

S10.4: Training Materials
• Video tutorials
• Workshop materials
• Quick reference guides

S10.5: Share & Disseminate
• Innovation forums
• Lunch & learns
• Newsletter articles
• Annual conference
Tools: Confluence, SharePoint, Video platforms, Collaboration tools
🌱 BB11: Innovation Culture & Change Management
Key Activities:
S11.1: Culture Assessment • Innovation Culture Survey • Focus Groups • Behavioral Analytics
S11.2: Change Strategy • Vision communication • Leadership alignment • Incentive design • Resistance management
S11.3: Community of Practice • Regular meetups • Mentoring program • Innovation challenges • Recognition system
S11.4: Continuous Learning • TRIZ certification pathway • Cross-industry benchmarking • Conference participation
Success Metrics: Innovation culture index, Employee engagement, Ideas generated, Projects completed
Change Phases: Awareness (3mo) → Adoption (6mo) → Acceleration (12mo) → Institutionalization (ongoing)
⚠️ BB12: Anticipatory Failure Determination (AFD)
Inversion technique: 'How can the solution fail?' → Preventive actions
S12.1: Define Ideal Failure • Most catastrophic scenario • Plausible failure modes • Impact assessment
S12.2: Failure Mechanisms • Cause-Effect Chain Analysis • Why-Not Diagram • Failure tree analysis
S12.3: Preventive Actions • Eliminate root cause • Compensate with control • Detect before impact
S12.4: Validation Planning • Stress test weak points • Failure mode testing • Robustness verification
Benefits: Proactive risk management, Higher reliability, Reduced warranty costs, Customer confidence
Integration: AFD results feed into P5 (Implementation) validation plans and risk mitigation
Supporting Framework Elements
Digital Tools Ecosystem
T1: Contradiction Matrix | T2: Su-Field Modeller | T3: PatentLens | T4: Effects DB | T5: 9-Windows | T6: Metrics Dashboard | T7: Function Analysis | T8: ARIZ Assistant
Innovation Metrics Framework
Leading: Contradictions identified, Ideality improvement | Lagging: Success rate, Cost savings, Patents | Organizational: Adoption rate, Culture index
Risk Management Categories
Technical | Market | Organizational | Financial | Compliance → Risk Matrix: Probability × Impact
Methodology Integration
Design Thinking | Lean Startup | Agile/Scrum | Six Sigma | Stage-Gate → Synergistic Innovation
TRIZ Competency Development Path
Bronze (40h) → Silver (80h) → Gold (160h) → Master (320h) | Certification + Projects + Mentoring
TRIZ Framework v5.0 | Author: Vijay Khanna | Comprehensive Enterprise Innovation System | 8 Core Processes | 12 Building Blocks | Complete Digital Integration
